comments.body: Ah I didn't see that suggestion when I made mine, I'll be sure to up-vote it. Thank you.
This would be soooo cool!

Ok I don't understand the first part of this , you're saying "A guard for villages! Unlike iron golems, guard is a TRADE that any villager can take up if the position is open and someone is unemployed" a trade and position are two very different things, so which one is it? Do you trade to get them or do they take a position somehow? I don't really get the idea for that not trying to be rude .

Also with ", they do not attempt to fight pillagers unless they attack another villager" that doesn't matter if the mobs attack first mojang still made it clear that they won't make villagers fight in any shape or form. I like the idea of them fighting but since that's not gonna happen we should improve golems or add a COMPLETELY new human type mob to guard a village .
It would be good if they only attack their natural in game enemies and dont run too far away from village when fighting
But I think that workstation for the guard would be an anvil! And there should be a barrack building for the workstation as well!
It is a very good idea that I also had in mind and I hope that if they put it.
nice!

Would surely make things a lot easier when it comes to wanting a certain item, but you just can't muster up enough wealth to do so. Example: Impaling V at the price of an entire stack of emeralds. Darn greedy Librarians.

Perhaps also gift them flowers.

They should also react with a positive sound when they recieve their gift.
We should be able to gift villagers and wandering traders, either that can get achievement or xp or discount for players in return. Also players should be able to pet the mobs

I like the idea of gifting them food, but you should also be able to gift them protective items, that still fit conceptually. They'd probably only wear leather armor, as others would be uncomfortable. You could also gift them potions to use in certain situations, like swiftness to escape pillagers, or healing if low on health. I want people to treat villagers like people, not like slaves, and I hope this could be a step in the right direction.
You can cure zombie villagers to restart a village so you don't need this

We need them to have the ability to respawn!!  I want to see Villagers respawn in proper living environments, places that qualify as Villages.  They are one of the only mobs in the whole game that don't seem to ever respawn or regenerate in a natural cycle, and with Mojang adding new hostile mobs to the game, it is harder than ever to find villagers, let alone keep them alive.  They get eaten by Zombies, stung by bees, fall off cliffs, shot by skeletons, drowned in water, or even wander off and get lost, never to return. Additions such as the Drowned have also wreaked havoc on villages that spawn near water and have devastated entire villager populations since they are there day and night.  I have some games where unless I go into creative/peaceful mode, villagers are extinct. Sometimes they are already extinct before I find them in a new game.

This is a problem, as it is incredibly hard to find and rehabilitate villagers that have turned into zombies.  Even if you CAN find one and rehabilitate them, you need to actually have at least 2 and keep them alive long enough to get them back to a village and make them want to breed.  In many cases getting villagers to become willing to breed requires a LOT of remodeling and planting.  All this, along with protecting them from both themselves and their surroundings, is a lot of work and hours upon hours of gameplay.

It should not take up such a huge chunk of my playtime just to have a functioning village!

I agree! I just survived a raid with ONE villager-that promptly got killed by a skeleton later that very night. I saw a suggestion of bringing in new villagers from another village by boat or minecart, but that's incredibly tedious and not very practical.

What if a child spawned and you had to care for it(feed and protect) into adulthood(say 3 days or however long it takes for young mobs to mature). I would be okay with that. Hard? Yes. But infinitely less tedious and certainly less costly than trying to transport one from another village.
Absolutely agree. This is ridiculous, I found an empty village not too long after I discovered it. There are too many things killing villagers!

I thought it would be interesting if Villager Workstations acted like their Respawn Anchors, but the problem is that it would be too OP if they always respawned because then you would always have a supply of villagers

There could be a Respawn Anchor for Villages that all Villagers connect to that enables them to respawn. I was thinking that it should use Golden Apples as fuel, as an allusion to Zombie Villagers being cured. This block could be made by the player, but it could also be generated in Villages, such as the central tree or well.

There could be a Conduit like item that uses Golden Apples as fuel. It would attack zombies with its particles like a normal Conduit, but it may not kill them, instead giving them weakness. Zombie Villagers, now with weakness coupled with the Golden Apples as fuel, would turn back into Villagers

Zombie villagers aren't really the answer. They have an incredibly low spawn chance of 5%. Also there is a really high frequency of pillager patrols and these mobs refuse to despawn. This leads to an eventual total loss of villagers in any server or singleplayer world.

I'm on a 3-year old server and the villages are ALL abandoned. So I can't get the What a Deal! achievement :( or do cool stuff like converting excess paper or redstone to emeralds.
What if I break all the beds in the village?  What if I leave a bed outside at night?
They‚Äôd probably die.

Few other remarks on this idea.

  1. It's less computationally expensive to calculate the presence of a bed than a house.

  2. It's more flexible. Hello dwarven villages deep underground.

  3. Each villager can claim a bed for their own, and go to bed at night. If a villager doesn't have a bed it will head for the nearest unassigned bed. Note - a bed that is a respawn point is assigned to the player. This also should prevent the cluster bug where all the villagers try to cram into one house in the center of the village.

It does break the stupid iron golem farms, but the makers of those can come up with new designs.

Additonal bonus would be the simple fact that it would look more realistic if the villagers actually slept instead of just standing in a corner all night.

 

Answering Bilbo Baggins: The same thing would happen as if you broke all the doors in a current village. If you built beds outside (presumably without walls) you would get the same result as if you built your village houses like this - current mechanics does not require houses to have any walls.
thats really good! also baby villagers would only spawn when there is another unused bed on village.
Looks like this has been implemented.
This is already a thing in game, how does this not have an updates or announced tag

THIS SHOULD GET DELETED OUTA HERE EMIDEATLY!!!
(i need my iron farms)
Love this idea. Gives a use to poisonous potatoes, plus it's kinda funny.
Any use for poisonous potatoes would be welcome
maybe just zombified piglins?
So I tried dropping a potato in front of the piglin, but it didnt pick it up.
Put a piece of gold on, and they're your best friend immediately.
that does not work btw
I think this is a good idea because if you have named a villager, you wouldn't want them to die.
This totally should be added!
This could possibly coincide with my villager grave stone idea. Maybe named villagers could drop a mineable gravestone of whatever level they died on.
That's cool
Gr

I hate needing to switch to hard mode so my villagers can't be killed. I understand the reasoning of keeping a village from being overrun by zombies, but maybe it can be made so that they won't attack or are weaker in lower difficulties?

This is the best fix idea I've seen so far. Doesn't create more undesired mobs to deal with on lower difficulty settings, but still ensures reliable access to the curing mechanic regardless of server difficulty.

This would be a great addition in light of the new snapshot that rebalances the curing discounts.
yeah your right!
Villagers have TERRIBLE self-preservation ai, I literally have to babyproof any village, and yet the villagers STILL find ways to kill themselves. Mojang, please fix the suicidal villagers!
The villagers do need better pathing.
neat idea, also evockers is spelled evokers
in the most recent snapshot 21w37a, illagers no longer attack baby villagers, it would be neat if a baby villager, due to spending time with illagers instead of villagers, turned to one of them

There should also be baby villagers in woodland mansions that grow into new illagers. You should be able to rescue them when you raid a woodland mansion, and they will follow you to a village, boosting your popularity in the village by a large amount.
this kinda makes sense but wouldnt the baby villager grow up and hate the illagers?
maybe they could add baby illagers
Fr we need this trade
This is exactly what I need
Fr man strings can be traded but spider eye's are just waste
Sounds like it would be a good fit for underground in mountainous biomes

I like this idea because if Mojang keeps adding people, armor, and weapons, most arguments with my friends over whether Minecraft or terraria is better, (there equal from my stand point, I just argue theres more to do in Minecraft) such as theres more npc's will bec crushed because instead of just villager, we now have piglins, mole people, cowlins, and viallagers each with roles in there own society thus making npc's of a sort
This post deserves more votes I wanna see some type of underground villager like mob in 1.17 üëç hope they fight hostile mobs
I think that is a great idea but maybe they could sell something like villagers. Maybe they could sell ores that are hard to find like diamonds or emeralds.
You should put this in the parity category.

Yes! Definitely! That way, I can have my own pillager village! Mwahahahaha! *Evil laugh* Something random! I don't know... XD Although, I can already do that with commands... I just think pillagers look better without the crossbow when they're peaceful.
I Really want to be able to do this.  I want several areas where I use the Pillager Mobs in my survival game.  Please add this. Thanks

a new weapon should be added just for them, I recommend a javelin because I feel like they should be proficient hunters. they are neutral but will respond to all kind of agression and attack. tribesmen should be wearing a variety of masks with unique patterns which can be a drop if you kill them and wearing the mask will make you one of them and will no longer respond to you attacking them in addition they will assist you in fighting hostile mobs if they see you being attacked other additional drops should bone accessories that can be crafted for vanity only this will make bones a precious item in the game, also tattoos, just like villagers with varying kind, tribesmen should also have this unique features and you will know it depending on the color of their tattoos, they should have a chief as well that you can challenge in a 1v1 combat, the chief will drop a sack bag with ores like gold, not to mention trading should be possible too.
LOVE IT, but maybe not just limited to Halloween. Maybe on full moons? Just like how Slimes spawn in swamps on full moons
not the enchanted golden apple, but everything else
This would be cool, I love seasonal events in games like terraria and Minecraft dungeons, anyway you have my vote
I like the Easter egg
A few things. First, we already have a Halloween Easter egg. So maybe every like 10 or 20 in-game days?
Second, no god apples

I do like this idea. I would even expand it to actually make all villagers be afraid of the dark. This would make sense since hostile mobs spawn in the dark and would prevent villagers from strolling into nearby dark caves during the day.

It would also be an incentive to have a player lighting up the village better than it is by default.

Perhaps villagers would even like a player for helping spreading light in the village :)
I like the idea, but if you do find one they should like to stay close to you when in the dark
I think it'd be neat to have two different tribes of the same mob fighting each other.

I think they'd stay apart from the other piglins, but they wouldn't attack each other. The nether shamans might simply be a variation of the piglins.

They would also interact with zombified piglins, and may be trying to figure out how to undo the zombification.
u mean neutral, not passive right?
I think this has already been added in, but I forget how you make a villager a medic(they can also be warriors and archers). I watched a video about it on YouTube.
Sierra, this hasn't been added, sorry, also, the Purifier idea, in my opinion is much better.
It should also heal hurt villagers.
whoever made this desevres to work at mojang studios
I mean like 15-18 beetroots for a emerald similar to carrots and potatoes
yes

Definitely. At the moment it's a useless crop. Red dye can come from poppies and roses, so why bother growing beetroot if that's all it is really good for (oh, and breeding pigs). It would be good if beetroot was also a breeding option food-wise for villagers. Basically, make it a genuine root vegetable, instead of just filler.
You'd think farmers would sell crops, not buy them...
I agree, so.....much......REDSTONE!!!
This could be a redstone engineer, who as the cartographer sells maps, would sell plans for simple redstone contraptions, which would help new players to start using redstone
I imagine that water bottles would be the base thing, with milk being better and so forth
I agree with deftfan27146994
Yea I think it would make it more like actual survival. But you shouldn't have to drink too often, like maybe every 3 minecraft days?
Id love for us to be able to drink from the water fountains in the sand biomes and drink from rivers itd be so cool!!
i think this would be a fantastic addition!
Loooooooove it !!! Imma ask some friends of mine to vote this if they agree !
Please vote for villagers

What if they war defender villager they would have shelds and swords the armor is base on how big the village is and if they have a Smith if they don't then they don't get aromor or iron tools and for the bigger villages they have a stone wall for the smaller one wooden and a Miner
PRETTY MUCH AWESOME BUT ALSO ADD WE CAN BECOME VILLAGE GODS THATS BETTER
Awesome idea! Was that inspired by the last of us?
Just a little
But there is already have zombiefed piglins. But still a good idea to have another fungus to infect piglins.

This is a great idea! These piglins should also be able to teleport, and have purple eyes, much like the endermen? Another idea: make these piglins skeletons. Perhaps the reason that piglins and hoglins avoid the warped forest is because it's toxic to Crimson forest animal life?

They should be called warped piglins, and there should also be warped hoglins, and maybe other types of warped nether mobs.

Perhaps they could act like regular piglins, but neutral if you are wearing blue leather armour rather than gold. They would not be hostile toward regular piglins, but the regular piglins would flee anyways. What would their relationship with endermen be?

This is a neat idea, especially given the lore of the warped forest. Maybe they could stand idle as if their minds were inactive and then instantly activate and try to kill anyone who aggravates an enderman or attacks another crazed piglin. Their previous desires have been mostly stripped away by the warped forest. However, a small sliver of their old self makes them hesitate for a brief moment when encountering gold, another piglin of any type except for crazed piglins, or soul fire, lanterns, torches, and campfires. They would also attack normal piglins which then might become infected after death similarly to zombie villagers. (Possibly creating crazed zombified piglins from normal zombie piglins?)
Honestly this is a great idea. I would love to see a crazed piglin.
I really hope this gets added.
Uh...... What if theirs heaps of gold? Will he keep bowing if so that's a bit OP to get then from attacking you.

I think they should maybe only try to stand on them if possible or at least if the AI has a route planed and the piglin sees a gold block, the AI would try to modify the route to go over the gold and make the piglin pause for a moment. Unless they're angered then they ignore the block. The fascination for gold is only triggered when the piglin is idle
They would not stop to bow when angered, and might return to the gold block and bow later... That would be really cool, and add some real depth to their obsession with gold.
